cards.Back: The habitual pattern of foods and beverages consumed over time—quality and pattern matter more than single nutrients.
Nutrient density: more vitamins/minerals/fiber/beneficial compounds per kcal (e.g., vegetables, legumes). Energy density: high kcal with fewer nutrients (ultra-processed snacks, fried foods).
Base most intake on minimally processed vegetables, fruits, whole grains, legumes, nuts and seeds; minimize added sugars, refined grains, sodium, and saturated fat.
Improves glycemic control and satiety, lowers LDL-C via bile acid binding, increases SCFA production, supports gut barrier, reduces risk of T2DM and colorectal cancer.

cards.Front: Daily fiber targets and best sources
cards.Back: ≈14 g per 1,000 kcal (~25 g women; ~38 g men). Sources: legumes, whole grains, vegetables, fruits, nuts, seeds (animal foods contain 0 g fiber).
Soluble: viscous, slows gastric emptying, lowers LDL (oats, legumes). Insoluble: adds bulk, speeds transit (whole grains, many veg).

cards.Front: Glycemic control—food swaps that lower postprandial glucose
cards.Back: Swap refined grains/sugars for legumes, intact whole grains, non-starchy vegetables; pair carbohydrate with fiber, protein, and healthy fats.
Look for '100% whole' and 'whole' before the grain name; use 10:1 carbs:fiber heuristic for packaged grain products.
WHO: <10% kcal (ideal <5%). AHA: ≤100 kcal/day for most women/children & ≤150 kcal/day for most men.

cards.Front: Top sources of added sugar in US diets
cards.Back: Sugar-sweetened beverages, desserts/sweet bakery, breads/tortillas, ready-to-eat cereals, condiments/sauces, coffee/tea drinks, syrups/jams.
Replace SSBs with water/unsweetened tea/coffee; flavor with fruit/herbs; set a daily limit; track in log.
UPFs are energy-dense, hyper-palatable and often high in added sugars, refined starch, sodium and unhealthy fats—drive excess intake and weight gain.
Shop the perimeter for produce/whole foods; choose short ingredient lists; cook more at home; prepare snacks like fruit, nuts, roasted chickpeas.
Aim for 5–6% of kcal from saturated fat; emphasize swaps to MUFA/PUFA (olive oil, nuts, seeds, fish).
Fatty cuts of beef/pork/lamb, processed meats (sausages/salami), high-fat dairy/cheese, butter/lard, many fast foods, tropical oils (coconut/palm).
Industrial trans fats largely removed from US food supply (PHOs revoked); still read labels and avoid 'partially hydrogenated' ingredients.
Favor whole-food sources of ALA (flax, chia, walnuts) and marine EPA/DHA where used; keep overall dietary pattern plant-predominant and minimally processed.
High-heat frying produces lipid oxidation products (aldehydes/LOPS); prefer baking, steaming, sautéing; if frying, keep temp/time minimal.
All essential amino acids are present across varied plant foods; RDA 0.8 g/kg met with balanced intake of legumes, whole grains, nuts/seeds.
Single plant foods can be lower in lysine or methionine, but variety across the day supplies all essential amino acids—no special combining at the same meal required.
Beans, lentils, peas, soy foods (tofu/tempeh/edamame) provide protein plus fiber and micronutrients missing from animal-only diets.
Replacing processed/red meat with legumes/nuts is associated with lower cardiometabolic risk; aligns with plant-predominant pattern.
Fortified plant milks/juices, tofu set with calcium sulfate, leafy greens (low-oxalate), beans, almonds/SESAME (tahini).
Few natural food sources; fortified foods common. Sunlight synthesis varies by latitude/skin/policy; consider supplementation per guidelines.

cards.Front: Potassium—why it's a shortfall and sources
cards.Back: Low intake common; higher in fruits/vegetables/legumes/whole grains; helps counter sodium’s BP effects.
Cofactor in hundreds of reactions (energy, glucose); sources include legumes, nuts, seeds, whole grains, greens.

cards.Front: Iron—plant vs animal and absorption tips
cards.Back: Plant (non-heme) iron absorbs better with vitamin C and when minimizing tea/coffee with meals; include legumes, greens, fortified grains.
Reliable B12 sources are fortified foods or supplements when intake of animal products is minimal.
Important for membranes and methylation; sources include legumes, soy, some nuts/seeds, and fortified foods.

cards.Front: Vitamins A, C, E, K—plant sources
cards.Back: Colorful vegetables/fruits (A,C), nuts/seeds/plant oils (E), leafy greens (K); overall plant-predominant pattern covers needs for most.
Vegetables, fruits, legumes, whole grains, nuts, olive oil; fish/poultry moderate; red/processed meats and sweets limited.
Higher adherence associated with lower CVD incidence/mortality; RCTs like PREDIMED showed fewer major CV events with Med + EVOO or nuts.
High fruits/vegetables/low-fat dairy; includes whole grains, nuts, legumes; low in sodium, sweets, and red/processed meats.
Hybrid of Mediterranean and DASH; emphasizes leafy greens and berries; limits butter, cheese, pastries, fried/fast food.
WFPB emphasizes minimally processed plants; Western diet high in UPFs, refined grains, added sugar, sodium and saturated fat—linked to obesity/T2DM/CVD.
≈5% DV or less is low; ≈20% DV or more is high—per serving.
Look for the word 'whole' before the grain (e.g., whole wheat). Beware 'multigrain'/'made with whole grain' claims.

cards.Front: Added Sugars on label—why it's important
cards.Back: Added Sugars line separates added from naturally occurring sugars; track to guide counseling toward <10% kcal.
Claims don't guarantee overall quality; verify with Nutrition Facts and ingredients; prefer shorter, recognizable ingredient lists.

cards.Front: Where sodium comes from & practical rule
cards.Back: Most sodium comes from commercially prepared/restaurant foods; quick rule: keep mg sodium per serving ≤ calories per serving to stay near 2,300 mg/day.
DASH lowers BP by emphasizing fruits/vegetables/low-fat dairy/whole grains and reducing sodium and processed meats/sweets.
Higher potassium from plant foods supports BP control; encourage beans, greens, potatoes, bananas, squash.

cards.Front: Simple meal pattern for busy patients
cards.Back: Build plates: ½ non-starchy vegetables, ¼ intact whole grains or starchy veg, ¼ legumes/lean proteins; add fruit; water/unsweetened beverages.
Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound: e.g., 'Add 1 cup vegetables at lunch 5 days/week for 4 weeks.'
Keep fruit visible; prep veg ahead; carry nuts/fruit; default water/tea; plan shopping list around produce and legumes.

cards.Front: Vignette (Sugars) #1: drinks 2 SSBs/day, evening cravings, weight gain.
cards.Back: Replace SSBs with water/unsweetened beverages; set daily limit; add fiber-rich snacks; track intake; aim <10% kcal added sugars.

cards.Front: Vignette (Sodium) #1: restaurant meals most nights; stage 1 hypertension.
cards.Back: Coach home cooking 5+ nights/week; mg≤kcal rule; request no added salt; choose DASH-style sides; monitor BP trend.

cards.Back: Avoid products with 'partially hydrogenated'; per-serving rounding can hide up to 0.5 g—choose alternatives.

cards.Back: Swap to minimally processed, short-ingredient-list foods; plan whole-food snacks (fruit, nuts, roasted legumes).

cards.Front: Vignette (Lipids) #1: LDL-C 160 mg/dL, prefers 'natural' coconut oil.
cards.Back: Limit saturated fat; replace coconut oil with olive/canola; increase soluble fiber (oats, legumes); recheck lipids in ~3 months.

cards.Back: Reassure adequacy with variety; include legumes, soy, whole grains, nuts/seeds; RDA 0.8 g/kg typically met.

WHO: <10% kcal (ideal <5%). AHA: ≤100 kcal/day women/teens; ≤150 kcal/day men.
Aim 5–6% of kcal from saturated fat; replace with MUFA/PUFA.
Keep mg sodium per serving ≤ calories per serving to be near ~2,300 mg/day overall.
≈14 g/1,000 kcal (~25 g women; ~38 g men).
Grams carbohydrate ≤ 10 × grams fiber → generally higher-quality grain choice.
Add leafy greens most days and berries several times per week.
Aim legumes most days (beans/lentils/peas/soy) for fiber and protein.

cards.Front: Quick recall #3: Nuts & seeds snack swap
cards.Back: Use a handful of nuts/seeds instead of UPF snacks for satiety and cardiometabolic benefits.
Prefer baking/steaming/sautéing over deep-frying to lower LOPS.
Default to water; keep a bottle visible; add citrus/herbs for flavor.
Add leafy greens most days and berries several times per week.
Aim legumes most days (beans/lentils/peas/soy) for fiber and protein.

Add leafy greens most days and berries several times per week.
Aim legumes most days (beans/lentils/peas/soy) for fiber and protein.

cards.Back: Use a handful of nuts/seeds instead of UPF snacks for satiety and cardiometabolic benefits.

cards.Front: Protein-rich plant foods (per serving) — quick list
cards.Back: Soy foods (tofu, tempeh, edamame) · Lentils/beans · Chickpeas · Peas · Seitan · Hemp hearts · Peanut/almond butter · Quinoa · High-protein whole-grain pastas.
Lentils · Black beans · Chickpeas · Split peas · Raspberries/blackberries · Pears (with skin) · Artichokes · Oats (steel-cut) · Chia/flax · Barley.
Oats/oat bran (β-glucan) · Barley · Psyllium · Beans/lentils/peas · Ground flax/chia · Apples/citrus · Okra · Eggplant.
Refined rice → intact brown rice/farro · White pasta → lentil/chickpea pasta · White bread → 100% whole grain/rye · Sugary cereal → oats/muesli · Juice → whole fruit.
Ground flax (1–2 Tbsp) · Chia seeds · Walnuts · Hemp seeds · Canola/soy oil (minimal, prefer whole foods).
Fish/seafood (where used) · Algae-derived EPA/DHA supplements for plant-exclusive eaters.
Butter → avocado/olive oil (light sauté) · Cream/cheese → cashew/soy yogurt or tofu-based sauces · Fatty red meat → beans/soy/legumes; add mushrooms/umami for satisfaction.

cards.Front: Top potassium foods for BP control
cards.Back: Beans/lentils · Potatoes/sweet potatoes · Leafy greens · Squash · Bananas · Avocado · Yogurt alternatives fortified with potassium.
Pumpkin seeds · Almonds/cashews · Black beans · Soy (edamame/tofu/tempeh) · Spinach/chard · Whole grains (brown rice, oats, barley).
Fortified plant milks/yogurts · Tofu set with calcium sulfate · Low-oxalate greens (bok choy, kale) · Tahini/sesame · Almonds · Beans. Tip: shake fortified milks; calcium settles.
Few foods naturally rich; rely on fortified foods plus sensible sun exposure as allowed; consider D3/D2 supplement per guideline and labs/history.
Legumes · Lentils · Soy · Pumpkin seeds · Quinoa · Dark greens; enhance with vitamin C (citrus, peppers). Inhibitors: tea/coffee with meals; high-calcium with iron foods.
Legumes · Lentils · Chickpeas · Nuts/seeds (pumpkin, sesame) · Whole grains; soaking/sprouting reduces phytates and can improve availability.
Use iodized salt in home cooking (within sodium limits) or seaweed in moderation; check prenatal needs; avoid excess from kelp concentrates.
Brazil nuts (1–2 pieces occasionally) · Whole grains · Legumes; avoid excess (UL risk) with high Brazil nut intake.
Reliable sources are fortified foods or B12 supplements; check dosing schedule and adherence; monitor per clinical context.
Membrane and methylation roles; sources include soy/legumes, quinoa, broccoli/cauliflower, peanuts, and fortified products.
Folate: leafy greens, legumes, citrus. Vitamin C: citrus, berries, peppers, crucifers; enhances non-heme iron absorption.
K: leafy greens (phylloquinone). E: nuts/seeds and plant oils (prefer minimal processing).
½ non-starchy veg · ¼ intact whole grains/starchy veg · ¼ legumes/lean proteins · Whole fruit; replace refined carbs/added sugars; fiber target ≈25–38 g/day; weight management if needed.
Swap refined grains for intact whole grains/legumes; add viscous fiber (oats/psyllium); avoid SSBs; prefer whole fruit over juice.
Fruit + nuts; veggies + hummus; edamame; chia pudding; plain soy yogurt + berries; roasted chickpeas.
Fruits/vegetables · Low-fat or fortified alternatives · Whole grains · Nuts/legumes; limit sodium, processed meats, sweets, sugar drinks.
Home cooking ≥5 days/wk; mg sodium ≤ kcal per serving rule; request no added salt at restaurants; choose fresh/low-sodium items; use herbs/acid for flavor.
Beans/lentils, potatoes, bananas, leafy greens, squash; check meds/renal status when advising high-K foods.
Reduce SFA & trans; add soluble fiber (oats/psyllium/legumes) · Nuts/seeds daily · Emphasize WFPB pattern; consider stanols/sterols per context.
Fatty beef/cheese → beans/soy · Butter → avocado/olive · Refined cereal → oats/barley · Snacks → nuts/seeds · Desserts → fruit-based options.
Weight loss if indicated; cut SSBs/fructose-heavy UPFs; plant-predominant pattern with high fiber; limit alcohol; prioritize physical activity.
Breakfast: oats + berries + flax; Lunch: grain bowl (quinoa/beans/greens) · Dinner: lentil/veg stew + salad · Snacks: fruit + nuts; water/unsweetened drinks.
Shift toward high-volume, low-energy-density foods (vegetables, fruits, soups, legumes, intact grains); minimize UPFs; self-monitor portions and triggers.
Choose grilled/steamed; ask for sauces/dressings on side; double vegetables; swap fries for salad/veg; zero-cal beverages.
Increase fiber gradually (legumes, whole grains, fruits/veg) + fluids; consider ground flax/chia and prunes; regular activity.
Smaller meals, avoid late eating; reduce high-fat/fried and trigger foods; weight loss if indicated; elevate head of bed.
Apple + peanut butter · Carrots + hummus · Edamame · Soy yogurt + berries · Whole-grain toast + tahini.
Citrus/vinegars · Garlic/ginger · Pepper/chili · Cumin/coriander · Italian blend · Smoked paprika · Fresh herbs (cilantro, basil, dill, parsley).
Ingredient starts with 'whole …'; ≥3 g fiber/serving on many items; 10:1 carbs:fiber heuristic; watch added sugars/sodium.
Prefer ≤5–6% kcal SFA AND <10% kcal added sugars overall; choose items with lower Added Sugars line; avoid syrups/sugar words high on list.

cards.Front: Micronutrient bundle: legumes do a lot
cards.Back: Fiber, protein, potassium, magnesium, iron, folate—anchor meals around beans/lentils/peas/soy for multi-nutrient coverage.
Healthy fats, protein, magnesium, vitamin E, selenium (Brazil nuts), zinc; small portions boost satiety and lipid profile.
Folate, vitamin K, magnesium, potassium, nitrates; pair with vitamin C foods to enhance iron absorption from meals.

cards.Front: Vignette: LDL 160 mg/dL, loves cheese & butter
cards.Back: Swap butter/cheese for avocado/olive and tofu/soy yogurt sauces; add soluble fiber (oats/psyllium/legumes); daily nuts; recheck in ~3 months.

cards.Front: Vignette: Stage 1 HTN, eats out 6 nights/week
cards.Back: Home-cook 5+ nights; mg≤kcal rule; no added salt requests; potassium-rich sides; consider DASH pattern; monitor home BP.
High-fiber dinners, protein + fiber snacks (apple+nuts), pre-portion snacks; remove SSBs/UPFs; consistent meal timing.

cards.Front: Quick pick list: high-protein whole grains
cards.Back: Quinoa · Teff · Farro · Amaranth · Buckwheat; also legume-based pastas.

cards.Front: Quick pick list: vitamin C standouts
cards.Back: Citrus · Kiwi · Berries · Bell peppers · Broccoli/cauliflower · Tomatoes.
Spinach · Kale · Lentils · Chickpeas · Black beans · Asparagus · Oranges.
Leafy greens (kale, collards, spinach, chard) · Broccoli · Brussels sprouts.
Sunflower seeds · Almonds · Hazelnuts · Peanuts · Wheat germ; minimally processed plant oils.
Iodized salt (home use) · Nori/seaweed in moderation · Fortified products; avoid excessive kelp.
Oats + berries + ground flax; Tofu veggie scramble + whole-grain toast; Overnight oats/chia; Fruit + soy yogurt + nuts/seeds.
Grain bowl: quinoa/farro + beans + greens + veg + seeds; Big salad + legumes; Veg soup + whole-grain bread.
Lentil/bean chili or stew; Stir-fry with tofu/edamame over brown rice; Baked potato/sweet potato with bean/veg toppings; Whole-grain pasta + tomato/veg sauce.
Favor small amounts of olive/canola/soy/peanut oils for light cooking; prefer whole-food fat sources (nuts/avocado) overall; minimize deep-frying to avoid LOPS.
Water first; unsweetened tea/coffee; seltzer with citrus; avoid SSBs/energy drinks; check meds/conditions for limits.
Fresh fruit; raw veg + hummus; roasted chickpeas/edamame; nuts/seeds (pre-portioned); whole-grain crackers + bean dip.
Fruit salad; baked apples/pears with cinnamon; dark chocolate (small portion) + berries; chia pudding.
